file_content.text: Good luck talking to Gord Madel and setting up the groundquake.
My lord... I... did you want something?
I'm interested to learn a little more about you.
Just curious.
Um, well, I don't know what there is to tell.
I was born on Nar Shaddaa. I'm good with--with computers and things... which I guess is why Paladius recruited me.
Just a little relaxation with my favorite female cultist.
A little chat, that's all.
Um, well, I'm flattered, but... I don't know, I mean, I'm just the computer girl.
Paladius brought me on to handle his records and then things went south with Destris, and the numbers didn't come out right and suddenly--
It's been a long time since I had a back rub.
A little worshipful attention.
I--um, I don't know. I've never, um... I guess I could give it a try?
If you don't know how, you'll only make things worse.
No, don't bother.
I didn't mean to make you uncomfortable.
It's okay.
Always so serious.
Oh, no, it's okay. It wasn't that... it's just... you're a little intimidating.
I'm sorry, I'm rambling. I shouldn't ramble.
You should be quiet before you annoy me further.
You're right, it's irritating.
I like listening to you.
It's okay.
You know, you're really sweet. Scary, but sweet.
Would you like to, I don't know, get something to drink--or I could show you around the compound, or....
I think this conversation has gone on long enough.
I'm sick of talking to you.
I'm--I'm sorry. I'll just go see if Destris needs my help.
Are your rooms on the tour?
Yes, I'd like that.
As long as I get to spend more time with you.
In your company, of course.
Good! Great! Let's do that!
Maybe you'd like to show me the compound a little? Your favorite rooms.
Could you give me a tour?
Um, yes! Yes, I'd like that! Let's do that!
Um, yeah, so that was nice--very nice. A little unexpected, but... nice.
But I guess you need to get back to work, don't you?
I think I'll be up for another tour shortly.
I'll talk to you later.
Suddenly, I can't stand to be near you.
This was a mistake.
I, um, I'm sorry? I didn't, I mean--I think maybe you'd better go. My lord.
Paladius won't lure himself out of hiding, I'm afraid.
I guess I must.
Well, um, you--you know where to find me.
My lord, I wanted--I wanted to apologize for Destris earlier. He was out of line.
At least one of you knows her place.
I love it when you grovel.
No need to apologize and no need to call me "lord."
Don't worry about it.
I confess I was worried when Destris said we were getting the help of a Sith.
I thought you'd be like Paladius--self-obsessed and cruel--but no, you're... kind.
That really depends on my mood.
I wouldn't go that far.
I can be quite tender when I want to be.
[Flirt] I'm glad you noticed.
For some reason I believe it.
On a scale from one to self-obsessed, I like to think I rate pretty highly.
Give me some credit!
I can only go off what I've seen.
Don't waste your breath apologizing for that fool.
He'll get what he has coming.
I have a great deal of respect for you. I just wanted you to know that.
You--you radiate a power that Paladius, for all his ranting and demanding, never did.
If you have something to say, then say it.
Why are you bothering me?
Yes, my lord, I'm sorry.
I don't need to rant. My will is done the moment I think it.
My power is real.
That's what I mean--you are strong, where Paladius only pretends to be.
I'm glad you noticed.
Why thank you.
Do you find that power attractive?
[Flirt.] Do you like it?
I don't know... it's terrifying.
Anyway, if we want to make a stab at taking over Paladius's cult, we need a real headquarters.
Somewhere you can speak, hold meetings... I hope you don't mind, but I took the liberty of finding a place.
You've done well. Now tell me about this place.
Good work.
This wouldn't be a ploy to out-play Destris for my favor?
You're strangely helpful.
I'm sorry. I thought the Sith smiled on ambition, but in any case, I was only trying to help.
It's not wise to go behind my back.
Don't do that again.
I'm sorry, my lord. It won't happen again.
The place is called the Strell House, for a charity worker named Daegin Strell. The people looked to him as a leader.
He's been dead nearly a decade, but his name still means something--and I thought it couldn't hurt to have his name associated with yours.
A well-known location can't hurt either.
You're right.
I'd considered that as well. It's both well-known and accessible.
It's hardly a seat of power.
I suppose it'll do.
Power is hard to come by on the lower levels of Nar Shaddaa.
It'll do.
I love it when you grovel.
I love it when you grovel.
Don't worry about it.
Don't worry about it.
My power is real.
My power is real.
Why thank you.
Why thank you.
[Flirt.] Do you like it?
[Flirt.] Do you like it?
Good work.
Good work.
Don't do that again.
Don't do that again.
